snippet: The Malaysian government, the largest shareholder in Proton Holdings, the parent of the niche British sports-car manufacturer, may divest itself of its stake in Proton, according to reports.
abstract: The Malaysian government, the largest shareholder in Proton Holdings, the parent of the niche British sports-car manufacturer, may divest itself of its stake in Proton, according to reports.
lead_paragraph: The ambitions of Lotus Cars, which showed six concepts just over a year ago at the Paris auto show, are again the subject of rumors and speculation. The Malaysian government may follow the advice once given by Colin Chapman, the founder of Lotus, to "simplify and add lightness" by divesting itself of Proton Holdings, the corporate parent of the boutique British sports-car manufacturer.

headline.main: With Ownership of Corporate Parent Reportedly in Flux, Lotus Cars Awaits a Resolution
